title: Task 1: Describe visual elements of a work of art
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not accurately describe a visual characteristic of The Swing (after Fragonard).
Response accurately describes one visual characteristic of The Swing (after Fragonard).
Response accurately describes two visual characteristics of The Swing (after Fragonard).

title: Task 2: Explain how a specific work of art demonstrates continuity within an artistic tradition, style, or practice
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not accurately use specific evidence to explain how the work references or departs from different earlier artistic traditions.
Response accurately uses one example of specific evidence to explain how the work references or departs from different earlier artistic traditions.
Response accurately uses two examples of specific evidence to explain how the work references or departs from different earlier artistic traditions.

title: Task 3: Explain why a specific work of art demonstrates change within an artistic tradition, style, or practice
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not accurately use specific evidence to explain how Shonibare creates meaning in this work by referencing earlier artistic traditions.
Response does accurately use specific evidence to explain how Shonibare creates meaning in this work by referencing earlier artistic traditions.
